1: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,\q
2:
"My thoughts make me answer quickly\q because of the worry that is in me.
\q
3:
I hear a rebuke that dishonors me,\q but a spirit from my understanding answers me.


\q
4:
Do you not know this fact from ancient times,\q when God placed man on earth:
\q
5:
the triumph of a wicked man is short,\q and the joy of a godless man lasts only for a moment?


\q
6:
Though his height reaches up to the heavens,\q and his head reaches to the clouds,
\q
7:
yet such a person will perish permanently like his own feces;\q those who have seen him will say, 'Where is he?'


\q
8:
He will fly away like a dream and will not be found;\q indeed, he will be chased away like a vision of the night.
\q
9:
The eye that saw him will see him no more;\q his place will see him no longer.


\q
10:
His children will apologize to poor people;\q his hands will have to give back his wealth.
\q
11:
His bones are full of youthful strength,\q but it will lie down with him in the dust.


\q
12:
Although wickedness is sweet in his mouth,\q although he hides it under his tongue,
\q
13:
although he holds it there and does not let it go\q but keeps it still in his mouthâ€”
\q
14:
the food in his intestines turns bitter;\q it becomes the poison of asps inside him.


\q
15:
He swallows down riches, but he will vomit them up again;\q God will cast them out of his stomach.
\q
16:
He will suck the poison of asps;\q the viper's tongue will kill him.


\q
17:
He will not enjoy the streams,\q the torrents of honey and butter.
\q
18:
He will give back the fruit of his labor and will not be able to eat it;\q he will not enjoy the wealth earned by his commerce.
\q
19:
For he has oppressed and neglected poor people;\q he has violently taken away houses that he did not build.


\q
20:
Because he has known no satisfaction himself,\q he will not be able to save anything in which he takes pleasure.
\q
21:
There is nothing left that he did not devour;\q therefore his prosperity will not be permanent.
\q
22:
In the abundance of his wealth he will fall into trouble;\q the hand of everyone who is in poverty will come against him.


\q
23:
When he is about to fill his stomach, God will throw the fierceness of his wrath on him;\q God will rain it down on him while he is eating.
\q
24:
Although that man will flee from the iron weapon,\q a bow of bronze will shoot him.
\q
27:
The heavens will reveal his iniquity,\q and the earth will rise up against him as a witness.

\q
28:
The wealth of his house will vanish;\q his goods will flow away on the day of God's wrath.
\q
29: This is the wicked man's portion from God,\q the heritage reserved for him by God."
